title: Chunk Array
description: Split an array into chunks of a specified size
instructions:
Write a function `chunkArray(arr, size)` that splits an array into smaller arrays (chunks) of the specified size.

Example: chunkArray([1, 2, 3, 4, 5], 2) should return [[1, 2], [3, 4], [5]]

hints.content: You'll need to create sub-arrays by taking 'size' elements at a time from the original array. Think about how to advance through the array by 'size' steps.
Use a loop that increments by 'size' instead of 1 (i += size). Use arr.slice(i, i + size) to extract each chunk and push it to a results array.

Create `const chunks = [];`. Loop with `for (let i = 0; i < arr.length; i += size)`. Extract chunks with `chunks.push(arr.slice(i, i + size))`. The slice method handles the last partial chunk automatically.
